Field.Name: anchors
Field.Value: where you want the origin of the texture. *"texture" uses the texture coordinates supplied *"screen" uses the origin of the screen as the origin of the texture

Field.Name: blending function
Field.Value: how to blend the textures together

Field.Name: map scales
Field.Value: how much to scale the textures

Field.Name: map offsets
Field.Value: how much to offset the origin of the texture

Field.Name: map
Field.Value: which maps to use

Field.Name: source/destination
Field.Value: These describe the relationship that causes the effect. * destination type is the type of variable you want to be effected * destination tells which texture map (or geometry offset) to apply it to * source says which value to look at when computing the effect

Field.Name: in/out bounds
Field.Value: When the source is at the lower inbound, the destination ends up the lower outbound and vice-versa applies for the upper values.

Field.Name: tint color bounds
Field.Value: If destination is tint, these values are used instead of the out bounds.

Field.Name: periodic functions
Field.Value: If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

Fields.Field1: interpolate between min/max flash colors as state changes

Field.Name: value scale#used for non-integral values, i.e. health and shields

Field.Name: Motion sensor center
Field.Value: The blips use this as a reference point
